content: k1 // p1 k1 kb k3 // k2 kb k1 p1 row 6 k1 yo k7 yo k1 // p1 k1 yo k4 // k3 yo k1 p1 row 7 k1 kb k7 kb k1 // p1 k1 kb k4 // k3 kb k1 p1 row 8 k1 yo k9 yo k1 // p1 k1 yo k5 // k4 yo k1 p1 row 9 k1 kb k9 kb k1 // p1 k1 kb k5 // k4 kb k1 p1 row 10 k1 yo k11 yo k1 // p1 k1 yo k6 // k5 yo k1 p1 row 11 k1 kb k11 kb k1 // p1 k1 kb k6 // k5 kb k1 p1 transfer 7 stitches from dp3 to dpn2 there is one stitch left on dpn3 row 12 using dpn3 with that one stitch on a knit together the next stitch from the front dpn with the next stitch from the back dpn b repeat a to b 14 more times knit the last stitch from back dpn on its own row 13 cast off all stitches froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 12 of 16 head - knit in the round the head starts with picking up stitches from the neck and the two sides and finishes with a 8 stitches i-cord for the snout the 6 buttonholes in the head are to let in the string between the eyes chart the yellow lines are to highlight the breaks between the dpn please note the stitches transfer at row 19 6 x 18 means 6 row of 18 stitches o are buttonholes froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 13 of 16 head detailed instructions pick up 8 st from the belly on dpn1 12 st from the right side on dpn2 12 from the row 17 k10 // k3 k2tog k2 // k2 sko k3 left side on dpn3 row 18 k10 // k2 k2tog k2 // k2 sko k2 row 1 k1 repeat 3x yo k2 yo k1 // k1 repeat 5x yo k2 yo k1 // k1 repeat 5x yo k2 yo k1 stitches transfer row 2 k1 repeat 3x kb k2 kb k1 // k1 repeat 5x kb k2 kb k1 // k1 repeat 5x kb slip 3st from dpn2 to dpn1 there are now 2 st on dpn2 and 13 on dpn1 k2 kb k1 slip 2st from dpn3 to dpn2 there are now 3 st on dpn3 and 4 on dpn2 row 3 k12 // k18 // k18 slip 5 st from dpn1 to a spare dpn knit those 5 st with dpn3 row 4 k12 // k18 // k18 now there are 8st on dpn1 4 on dpn2 and 8 on dpn3 row 5 k12 // k18 // k18 row 6 k12 // k18 // k18 row 19 k6 k2tog // k4 // sko k6 row 7 buttonholes k12 // k3 yo k2tog k13 // k14 yo k2tog k2 row 20 buttonholes k2 yo k2tog k1 k2tog // k4 // sko k2 yo k2tog
